item.title: 12 essential client management rules
item.description: Below are my notes from the insightful presentation “Secrets to Optimal Client Service, With Jim Donovan” by the University of Virginia School of Law. Never use jargon Clients likely won’t understand technical terms, and they’re even less likely to admit when they don’t understand. This makes them feel foolish and they’ll blame you for it. Use pauses Pauses create opportunities for clients to ask questions or provide comments. Pauses also help you slow down, appear less anxious and more composed.
